variable.name: SiteSubjID
variable.description: ID consisting of Site (3 digits), Family (4 digits) and Individual within family (3 digits) with hyphens between the 3 elements
variable.comment: Assigned ID

variable.name: Study
variable.description: MGS1 (Molecular Genetics of Schizophrenia 1) (our affected sib pair study) or MGS2 (Molecular Genetics of Schizophrenia 2) (the current case-control study) or SGI (a previous affected sib pair study)
variable.comment: The location refers to the study location (geographical) that recruited and evaluated the subject, and specifically is LA=Louisiana, AU= Australia, IL=Illinois, CO=Colorado, GA=Georgia (site collecting from GA in MGS2, collected from TX in MGS1), CA=California (site collecting from CA-Irvine in MGS1 and part of MGS2, later collected from CA-San Francisco in MGS2), IA=Iowa, NY=New York (the site, NY-Columbia, collecting SGI cases was a different site from the site, NY-Mount Sinai, collecting MGS1 and MGS2 cases in NY), PA=Pennsylvania (site collecting from PA in MGS1 and part of MGS2, later collected from CA-Stanford in MGS2), MO=Missouri (same site collected cases in MGS1, and MGS2), TX=Texas (site collecting from TX in MGS1, collected from GA in MGS2).
variable.value: a previous affected sib pair study

variable.name: Sex
variable.description: Sex (male, female)

variable.name: DNA_ID
variable.description: The ID number assigned by the Rutgers DNA and Cell Repository to this subjects DNA specimens
variable.comment: Permanent specimen ID assigned by repository

variable.name: Location
variable.description: Study location (geographical) that recruited and evaluated the subject
variable.comment: The location refers to the study location (geographical) that recruited and evaluated the subject, and specifically is LA=Louisiana, AU= Australia, IL=Illinois, CO=Colorado, GA=Georgia (site collecting from GA in MGS2, collected from TX in MGS1), CA=California (site collecting from CA-Irvine in MGS1 and part of MGS2, later collected from CA-San Francisco in MGS2), IA=Iowa, NY=New York (the site, NY-Columbia, collecting SGI cases was a different site from the site, NY-Mount Sinai, collecting MGS1 and MGS2 cases in NY), PA=Pennsylvania (site collecting from PA in MGS1 and part of MGS2, later collected from CA-Stanford in MGS2), MO=Missouri (same site collected cases in MGS1, and MGS2), TX=Texas (site collecting from TX in MGS1, collected from GA in MGS2).

variable.name: Self-ident-ancestry
variable.description: Self-identified ethnic ancestry

variable.name: Age_at_interview
variable.description: Age at which the subject was interviewed (NA means not available, true age of subject could not be determined, duration of illness estimated)
variable.comment: Computed from birth date and present date
variable.value: Not available, true age of subject could not be determined (duration illness estimated)

variable.name: Digs
variable.description: Was the subject able to complete an in-person diagnostic interview (DIGS- Diagnostic Interview for Genetic Studies) (i.e., some schizophrenia patients cannot participate adequately to provide valid information, but are willing to consent for the other aspects of the study including obtaining medical records)
variable.comment: All subjects asked to participate in DIGS interview; small proportion are unable to complete it in a valid way due to psychiatric disorder, but agree to other procedures

variable.name: Figs
variable.description: Did at least one family member provide a FIGS (Family History Interview for Genetic Studies) interview to provide observations on the subjects psychiatric history and symptom
variable.comment: All subjects are asked to invite a family member to be informant; some subjects refuse, or family member cannot be reached or refuses

variable.name: MedRec
variable.description: Was at least 1 record obtained from a hospital, clinic or clinician about the subjects psychiatric history?
variable.comment: All subjects are asked to sign consents for medical records to obtained for previous psychiatric treatment

variable.name: FH_psychosis
variable.description: Was there evidence of a history of psychotic illness in relatives? [0=No evidence of family history of a psychotic illness (MGS2 cases, complete assessment of family not made); 1=Suspected history of psychotic disorder in a first- or second-degree relative (MGS2, see protocol description); 2=Definite history of psychotic disorder in a sibling, half sibling or parent (MGS1, all diagnoses in relatives were based on full in-person assessment and consensus diagnosis)]
variable.comment: For MGS1, this is always definite or "2", because all probands had at least 1 full or half sibling or parent with a consensus diagnosis of SZ or SZ by direct interview and full consensus diagnostic procedure. For MGS2, the maximum rating was 1, indicating a suspicion of psychotic disorder based on family history information: diagnosticians arrived at consensus ratings of first- or second-degree relatives based on family history information only, either from the proband or from a family informant, with this variable = "Y" if the consensus for at least one such relative was "2" (likely, present) or "3" (definite) that some psychotic disorder was present, regardless of the most likely DSM diagnosis for the psychosis. Thus for MGS2, a rating here of "0" simply means that no positive information was obtained to suggest a probably positive FH, and this cannot be interpreted as absence of family history.
variable.value: No evidence of family history of a psychotic illness (MGS2 cases, complete assessment of family not made)
Suspected history of psychotic disorder in a first- or second-degree relative (MGS2, see protocol description)
Definite history of psychotic disorder in a sibling, half sibling or parent (MGS1, all diagnoses in relatives were based on full in-person assessment and consensus diagnosis)

variable.name: dx_cs_1
variable.description: DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) diagnosis code for the Best Estimate Final Diagnosis
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus

variable.name: cnf_cs_1
variable.description: Consensus confidence level assigned to the diagnosis
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus
variable.value: Likely (requires some interpretation of evidence, present)

variable.name: aao_cs_1
variable.description: Consensus age at onset (most likely age for onset of psychotic symptoms consistent with the onset of schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus
variable.value: Unknown age at onset, unable to estimate with confidence, or AAO not applicable such as for mental retardation or personality disorder

variable.name: dx_cs_2
variable.description: DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) diagnosis code for any additional psychiatric or substance use disorder supported by the data, determined by consensus (up to 4 secondary diagnoses included in file)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus

variable.name: cnf_cs_2
variable.description: Consensus confidence level assigned to the diagnosis
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus Variable contains data (e.g. levels of diagnostic confidence for many different disorders which happen to be the second diagnosis) for which a statistical summary is not useful.
variable.value: Likely (requires some interpretation of evidence, present)

variable.name: aao_cs_2
variable.description: Consensus age at onset of the diagnosis
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus Variable contains data (e.g. ages at onset for many different disorders which happen to be the second diagnosis) for which a statistical summary is not useful.
variable.value: Unknown age at onset, unable to estimate with confidence, or AAO not applicable such as for mental retardation or personality disorder

variable.description: DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) diagnosis code for any additional psychiatric or substance use disorder supported by the data, determined by consensus (up to 4 secondary diagnoses included in file)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus

variable.description: Consensus confidence level assigned to the diagnosis
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus Variable contains data (e.g. levels of diagnostic confidence for many different disorders which happen to be the third diagnosis) for which a statistical summary is not useful.
variable.value: Likely (requires some interpretation of evidence, present)

variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician (PI or senior research clinician delegate) reviews diagnostic ratings made independent by two research diagnosticians (one of which could be the consensus diagnostician as well), and assigns a final diagnosis, confidence level and AAO if there is agreement, or facilitates discussion of diagnosticians to achieve consensus Variable contains data (e.g. ages at onset for many different disorders which happen to be the third diagnosis) for which a statistical summary is not useful.
variable.value: Unknown age at onset, unable to estimate with confidence, or AAO not applicable such as for mental retardation or personality disorder

variable.value: Unknown age at onset, unable to estimate with confidence; or AAO not applicable such as for mental retardation or personality disorder

variable.name: SumCritA
variable.description: The total of items cs_A1 through A5 (variables) - note that bizarre delusions (A1a) and voices commenting or conversing (A2a) count as an extra "point", so that a sum of 2 indicates that Criterion A has been med (e.g., for bizarre delusions, one would get 1 for A1 and 1 for A1a, totaling 2) - NOTE: by definition, all subjects with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder diagnoses were judged as meeting DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criteria B-F for schizophrenia
variable.comment: See following 7 items
variable.value: Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 0
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 1
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 2
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 3
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 4
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 5
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 6
Sum of cs_A1, cs_A1a, cs_A2, cs_A2a, cs_A3, cs_A4, cs_A5 equals 7

variable.name: cs_A1
variable.description: Consensus rating for DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) schizophrenia criterion A1 (delusions)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A1a
variable.description: Consensus rating for presence of bizarre delusions as defined in DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) (implausible, impossible, including Schneiderian delusions), (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A2
variable.description: Consensus rating for DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) schizophrenia criterion A2 (hallucinations), (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A2a
variable.description: Consensus rating for presence of auditory hallucinations consisting of voices that converse with each other and/or comment on the subjects thoughts or behavior, (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A3
variable.description: Consensus rating for DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) schizophrenia criterion A3 (disorganized speech - frequent derailment or incoherence), (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A4
variable.description: Consensus rating for DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) schizophrenia criterion A4 (grossly disorganized or catatonic behavior), (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: cs_A5
variable.description: Consensus rating for DSM-IV (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) schizophrenia criterion A rating A1 (negative symptoms - affective flattening, alogia, avolition), (1=present, 0=absent)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discuss of consensus

variable.name: MonthsIll
variable.description: Consensus estimate of the lifetime total of months that the subject has had active residual schizophrenia (or schizoaffective disorder)
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician estimates number of months of schizophrenic illness (active residual) lifetime, based on all sources of information, by agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discussion of consensus

variable.name: MonthsMood
variable.description: Consensus estimate of the lifetime total of months that the subject has had full mood syndromes (mania or depression) - note, ratio of MonthsMood/MonthsIll required to be >= 0.3 to diagnose schizoaffective disorder
variable.comment: Consensus diagnostician estimates number of months of manic or depressive syndromes, based on all sources of information, by agreement of two independent diagnosticians or discussion of consensus

variable.name: Auditory_Halns_Ever[I10920]
variable.description: Auditory hallucinations - ever (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I10920]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.description: Visual hallucinations - ever (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I10930]

variable.name: Del_Also_Hal[I12840]
variable.description: Delusions accompanied by hallucinations, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I12840]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: AH_Threatening[I17705]
variable.description: AH (auditory hallucinations) threatening (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I17705]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on all information obtained in interview

variable.name: Mood_Incongruent_Hal[I17706]
variable.description: Mood incongruent hallucinations as judged by the interviewer, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I17706]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on all information obtained in interview

variable.name: Erotomanic_Delusions[I20970]
variable.description: Erotomanic delusions (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I20970]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Odd_Behavior[I12920]
variable.description: Odd behavior by the subjects own report or interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I12920]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Disorganized_Speech[I12990]
variable.description: Disorganized speech characteristic of formal thought disorder, by the subjects own report or interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I12990]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Odd_Speech[I13060]
variable.description: Odd speech (digressive, vague, but could include looseness of associations), by the subjects own report or interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13060]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Avolition_Apathy[I13240]
variable.description: Avolition or apathy, by the subjects own report or interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13240]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: No_Emotions[I13310]
variable.description: No emotions/flat affect, by the subjects own report or interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13310]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Onset_Del_Hal_Other[I13570]
variable.description: Age at onset of delusions, hallucinations or other criteria for schizophrenia, by subjects report or interviewers judgment , followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13570]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Psych_SX_Duration_Days[I13580]
variable.description: Duration of psychotic symptoms according to subject, in days if less than one week, otherwise coded as weeks in next item and this item is blank, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13580]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Psych_SX_Duration_Weeks[I13590]
variable.description: Duration of psychotic symptoms according to subject, in weeks if at least one week, otherwise coded as days in previous item and this item is blank, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13580]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Return_Normal_for_2Months[I13600]
variable.description: Subjects report of whether he/she ever returned to "normal" for w or more months at a time, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13600]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Unable_To_Function[I13720]
variable.description: Subjects report of having decrease in psychosocial function in most recent episode , followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I13720]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Polydypsia[I14340]
variable.description: Polydypsia, by subjects report, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I14340]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on subjects response to probe question in DIGS and further discussion as needed, plus any relevant information obtained during the entire interview

variable.name: Pattern_Sx[I14350]
variable.description: Pattern of positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia , followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I14350]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on all information obtained in interview
variable.value: Predominantly positive converting to predominantly negative
Continuous mixture of positive and negative symptoms

variable.name: Severity_Pattern[I14360]
variable.description: Severity/deterioration over the course of illness, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I14360]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on all information obtained in interview

variable.name: Disorg/Inapp_Behav[I21050]
variable.description: Disorganized or inappropriate behavior, by subjects report or by interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I21050]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only

variable.name: Alogia[I21400]
variable.description: Alogia, by subjects report or by interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I21400]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only

variable.name: Unable_To_Function_Most_Time_Since_Onset[I21500]
variable.description: Unable to function most time since onset, by subjects report or by interviewers observation (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I21500]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only

variable.name: Classification_Longitud_SZ[I21560]
variable.description: Severity pattern in terms of relapsing/remitting course, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [I14360]
variable.comment: Interviewer rating based on all information obtained in interview
variable.value: Episodic with no interepisode residual symptoms

variable.name: DSM4_Delusions[A60a]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for criterion A item for Delusions, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60a]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_Definite_Bizarre_Del[A60b]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for Definite Bizarre Del, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60b]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_Hallucinations[A60c]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for Hallucinations, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60c]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_2+Voices_Commented[A60d]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for 2+Voices Commented, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60d]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_Disorganized_Speech[A60e]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for Disorganized Speech, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60e]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_Gross_Disorganization[A60f]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for Gross Disorganization, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60f]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: DSM4_Negative_Sx[A60g]
variable.description: Interviewer rating of presence/absence of DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) criterion A item for negative symptoms, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60g]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only
variable.value: Absent (or insufficient evidence to rate as present)

variable.name: Total_DSM4_Sx[A60h]
variable.description: Total DSM4 (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders) symptoms (when psychotic and without other comorbid features present), followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A60h]
variable.comment: Total count of the above 7 interviewer ratings of DMS4 criteria for schizophrenia

variable.name: Psychosis_without_Dep_Mania[A620]
variable.description: Psychosis ever present without depression or mania according to subject, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A620]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only

variable.name: Psychosis_without_Dep_Mania_>=1week[A62a]
variable.description: Psychosis ever present without depression or mania for one week or more, according to subject, followed by the raw repository SAS database field name in brackets for cross-reference to repository database [A620]
variable.comment: Interviewer rates each DSM-IV criterion for schizophrenia as present or absent based on information from the interview only

variable.name: Country_of_birth[I50]
variable.description: Subjects report of country of birth

variable.name: Ethnicity_Maternal_1[I60]
variable.description: Subjects text descriptor of mothers ethnicity, one of up to four descriptors recorded without estimating proportions, and raw SAS file code for this variable in brackets
variable.comment: Interviewer asks "What is the ethnic background of your biological parents?" and records up to four ethnicities for each parent, first in the subjects words, and then selecting one of 16 codes to group the responses
